title: Vicky Pattison breaks down in tears and admits she feels 'ashamed' of herself
text:
Vicky Pattison has admitted she feels 'ashamed of herself' and believes she has been a 'little bit irresponsible' after attending a fertility clinic appointment.

The TV presenter, 31, attends a check up during the upcoming episode of her show Vicky Pattison: No Filter to see what the likelihood of her conceiving children is.

During the session Vicky is told that if she wants to stay healthy enough to have a baby in the future she should cut down on her alcohol intake.

'Ashamed': Vicky Pattison has admitted she feels 'ashamed of herself' and believes she has been a 'little bit irresponsible' after attending a fertility clinic appointment

As she prepares to return to the clinic for her test results, Vicky confesses that she'd be heartbroken if the news was bad. 'I never thought I'd be this worried about motherhood being part of my future,' she says.

'If I get the results and they're bad, or I can't freeze my eggs or something, I will be devastated. I definitely want to be a mum.'

Thankfully, the results are positive, revealing that Vicky's blood hormone level is optimal for her age, and that she has a healthy number of egg follicles.

But Vicky is brought quickly back down to Earth when she is told that she does need to make changes to her lifestyle if she's planning on becoming a mother.

Emotional: Following her trip to the clinic, Vicky shared a tearful selfie with an emotional caption about how hard she found waiting for her fertility test results

She penned: 'This is a picture of me the morning that I had to collect my results from the fertility clinic. I am usually quite a strong, together woman - but on that morning I felt like a scared little girl'

Check up: The TV presenter, 31, attends a check up during the upcoming episode of her show Vicky Pattison: No Filter to see what the likelihood of her conceiving children is

'Your lifestyle, let me just highlight a few things' the Doctor starts. 'The alcohol needs to come down a bit. The recommendation is that that you drink less than five units per week.'

With the news ringing in her ears, Vicky can't contain her shock. 'I have downright revelled in my party girl lifestyle,' Vicky says.

'I've loved it and never once regretted it. I never once considered the ramifications of my lifestyle.'

However later during a confessional, Vicky admits that she hasn't been entirely sensible with her life choices, she said: 'I've been a little bit irresponsible. I feel a little bit ashamed of myself.'

Be sensible: During the session Vicky is told that if she wants to stay healthy enough to have a baby in the future she should cut down on her alcohol intake

Following her trip to the clinic, Vicky shared a tearful selfie with an emotional caption about how hard she found waiting for her fertility test results.

She penned: 'This is a picture of me the morning that I had to collect my results from the fertility clinic. I am usually quite a strong, together woman - but on that morning I felt like a scared little girl.

Vicky continued: 'Tormented by the possibility that my childish decisions over the years may have stopped me from being able to have a baby.'

As she prepares to return to the clinic for her test results, Vicky confesses that she'd be heartbroken if the news was bad. 'I never thought I'd be this worried about motherhood being part of my future,' she says

Last week Vicky confessed she is considering freezing her eggs 'to take the pressure off' as she looks ahead to starting a family.

Vicky said while she doesn't want to rush into having children while her relationship to boyfriend Ercan Ramadan, 26, is still new, she wants to take 'precautions' to ensure she can have children when the time is right.

During a heart-to-heart about her future with her mum Caroll, Vicky mused: 'I have never, ever known a fella worry about having kids. But women, God, I don’t know how many women I’ve had that conversation with.

Planning for the future: Last week Vicky confessed she is considering freezing her eggs 'to take the pressure off' as she looks ahead to starting a family

'I am going to want to have kids in the next five to 10 years. I didn’t want kids and I was adamant I didn’t, but I feel like what would my future be without them?'

Vicky told her mum Caroll about her fears, revealing that she’s already thinking of taking the next steps with her plans for the future.

'I don’t want the door to close', the former Geordie Shore star admitted.

He's The One! The star confessed that while she doesn't want to rush into having children while her relationship to boyfriend Ercan Ramadan is still new, she wants to take 'precautions'

'There’s options. So, I can freeze my eggs. I just think it’ll take a little bit of pressure off the way I’m feeling.

'I’d love to have children the traditional way, I’m just taking precautions.'

Vicky Pattison: No Filter airs on Wednesday night at 10pm on Quest Red.
